posts.post_content:
To everyone saying "lol this and [indestructibility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=indestructibility) is OP" or "put [whispersilk cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=whispersilk cloak) on and lol at your opponent," I have had to deal with both scenarios. [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize), [Solemn Offering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solemn Offering), [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder), [Planar Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planar Cleansing) into [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), etc all work wonders.   
  
It's a good card, but has its weaknesses like every card does. High mana cost, vunerability, and being a high value target are just a few of the problems with a card like this. The biggest problem is lulling its player into a false sense of security. Whats gonna keep you from taking those 2 [Stampeding Rhino](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stampeding Rhino)s to the face? You cant lose! Until they [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) and [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), or any other combination of removal cards. Not to mention, enchant/artifact removal is a big sideboard element, as well as something many people ma... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: A very deserving candidate for the relatively new mantle of Mythic Rarity. I like that this is in the core set because it absolutely epitomizes the power that cards have to override the rules; when my friend told me about this card while I was still a newbie, I was convinced it couldn't be real. But nope...in Magic, nothing's impossible.

Posted By: ratchet1215 (8/28/2009 9:58:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Overrated in my opinion. Gives you a false sense of security. Any bounce/steal/destroy/whatever effect can make short work of it and of you as well.  
  
Even if you give it shroud AND make it indestructible there are many ways of getting rid of it. [sudden spoiling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sudden spoiling) for example, or [innocent blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=innocent blood), and many many other ways.  
  
I mean, it's a 4/4 flyer for 7 mana, which, by itself, is pretty bad. And it's an artifact and a creature, which means it dies very very quickly. It's only powerful if combined with many other cards to protect it, and even then your opponent might have answerse. And you could have just replaced the angel and dozens of cards with something that actually wins you the game, instead of stalling it.  
  
The effect is powerful of this card, but in my opinion it's very overrated. If I'm right it never appeared in any tournament worthy deck either.
posts.html:

It's only powerful if combined with many other cards to protect it, and even then your opponent might have answerse. And you could have just replaced the angel and dozens of cards with something that actually wins you the game, instead of stalling it.

The effect is powerful of this card, but in my opinion it's very overrated. If I'm right it never appeared in any tournament worthy deck either.

posts.post_content: I like this card. It has answers, as has been said, but that's true of every card out there, and the effect is an extremely potent one. It also stands up to [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism) and most burn. If nothing else, it's a must-remove threat that can't be allowed to stay on the field, in the most literal possible sense.

Posted By: henz90 (9/27/2009 10:32:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
Everyone is saying how this card doesn't work in play, I must disagree.  
  
I use this in a blue artifact deck with tons of counterspells and sroud-giving enchants. The only thing to remember is that this won't win the game it just gives you protection. You can use this to defeat your opponent while you're already at 0 life. Much better protection than a wall.   
  
This card is also extremely useful as the best distraction card in the game. While its up no one will be after me or my other creatures giving my heavy hitters like [Guile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guile) or [Inkwell Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkwell Leviathan) to do their job.   
  
An excellent card as long as u remember to defeat your opponent instead of just depending on it to make u invulnerable

posts.post_content: Just with any other card, there's a really simple way around this card regardless of how you enchant it. If it has shroud, simply return the enchantment to the owners hand or destroy said enchantment, then getting rid of the angel is as simple as any other creature. Just keep getting their health as low as you can, and if they're at 0 or less life, then make your move to destroy it.
posts.html:

Posted By: chainerrhysaltaiir (8/1/2009 5:26:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
[Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter) + [Ethersworn Canonist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ethersworn Canonist) + this card = watch your opponent scoop. Just have a [Negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Negate) handy for spells like [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) and the like. You don't need to do anything; just sit back and watch him run out of cards to draw (eventually).
  
   
I am surprised by all the comments about how ineffective this card is. Good players always look at and scrutinize a card's potential. This will not be a mythic rare if it's THAT lame. Deck-builders need to tap inside their inner-Johnny when dealing with a card like this. I see this card anchoring type 1 control decks. It might not be as strong in the current metagame, but in Vintage -- wow.
  
   
At least it's not blatantly obscene like [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). 4/5
posts.html:

Deck-builders need to tap inside their inner-Johnny when dealing with a card like this. I see this card anchoring type 1 control decks. posts.post_content: Nice card, but easy to counter or return to hand, even if it has shroud (by lightning greaves for example). Simply cast Into the Roil, and then shatter, or blaze, or electrostatic bolt...Whatever ya got that kills it, gets rid of it, or takes control of it. If you have an artifact heavy deck with her and Master Transmuter or Copper Gnomes , consider putting Filigree Angel in there too in case you get under 1 health.

posts.post_content:
One of the most definite and effective stalls in the game, but the player has to keep in mind that that's all it is: a stall. As neat as it is, this won't win the game for you. If it was an 8/8 with flying, trample, and shroud, then yes, it might win the game for you, but as it stands it can only buy you time to set up what you need, and this is probably where noobs fail when they use this card.   
  
Nevertheless, definitely worth having from a collecting standpoint, even if it isn't the most effective battle card. I bought one.
posts.html:
One of the most definite and effective stalls in the game, but the player has to keep in mind that that's all it is: a stall. As neat as it is, this won't win the game for you. If it was an 8/8 with flying, trample, and shroud, then yes, it might win the game for you, but as it stands it can only buy you time to set up what you need, and this is probably where noobs fail when they use this card.

Nevertheless, definitely worth having from a collecting standpoint, even if it isn't the most effective battle card. I bought one.
